node.title: Slow pace of welfare reform increasing pandemic-related inequity - report
node.description: Faster action on welfare reform could have eased some of the pressure on struggling families over lockdown, the Child Poverty Action Group says.

node.title: Netflix and the Internet of Fads
node.description: Netflix and TikTok have supercharged fame.

node.title: Rohingya Refugees Sue Meta for $150B, Say Failure to Stop Hate Speech Led to Genocide
node.description: The lawsuit says Facebook spread misinformation and hate speech that "amounted to a substantial cause, and eventual perpetuation of, the Rohingya genocide."

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Says in Hindsight Traveling to Kenosha 'Probably Not the Best Idea'
node.description: Rittenhouse, 18, was acquitted on all charges last month after fatally shooting two men and injuring a third during protests in Kenosha, Wisconsin, last summer.

node.title: Leftover food from Queenstown cafes to be saved from waste
node.description: Bakery and cafe treats that would otherwise go to waste are being rescued and given to charities that help feed those in need in Queenstown.

node.title: Nick Cannon's 5-month-old son dies of brain cancer
node.description: Zen, Cannon's youngest son, died from a form of brain cancer.

node.title: Sinking natural gas prices are a sign of hope for household winter heating bills.
node.description: The drop came after government weather forecasts projected a warmer-than-expected winter for most of the country.

node.title: Disney hires Geoff Morrell, a BP executive, as its corporate affairs chief.
node.description: Mr. Morrell’s hiring ends a guessing game about who Bob Chapek, Disney’s chief, would select to succeed Zenia B. Mucha, who announced her retirement as Disney’s chief communications officer in July.

node.title: As Omicron Threat Looms, Inflation Limits Fed’s Room to Maneuver
node.description: The central bank has spent years guarding against economic blows. Now it is in inflation-fighting mode, even as a potential risk emerges.

node.title: Michael Jackson Musical Turns Down Volume on Abuse Allegations
node.description: The Broadway musical, “MJ,” with a book by Lynn Nottage and directed by Christopher Wheeldon, began previews Monday.

node.title: Charlottesville’s Statue of Robert E. Lee Will Be Melted Down
node.description: The statue was the focus of a deadly white nationalist rally in 2017. A local African American heritage center plans to turn it into a new piece of public art.

node.title: Captioners Say Most Mispronounced Words of Year Include Omicron and a 'Squid Game' Treat
node.description: The U.S. Captioning Company released the report commissioned by the language-learning platform Babbel.

node.title: Sylvia Matthews Killed by Man Released From Years in Prison for Stalking Her: Police
node.description: Earlier in the year, the woman accused him of putting her in a headlock and punching her in the face. A report filed against him was ultimately suspended.

node.title: Insured Michigan Drivers to Get $400 Check Next Year Thanks to State Fund Surplus
node.description: "I will always work to put money back into Michiganders' pockets," Governor Gretchen Whitmer said in a tweet.

node.title: Wastewater Helps Cities Detect Community Spread of COVID Variants Like Omicron
node.description: Wastewater tests tend to be more accurate, as patients shed the virus into waste even when asymptomatic or when they test negative for COVID.

node.title: TikToker Surprises Husband With Pet Cow in Viral Clip: 'Where the F**k Did You Get a Cow?'
node.description: "You know I love you, right?" asks Destiny Lane of her husband before telling him about the new member of the family.

node.title: 'We need a critical mass here': Tourist spots prepare for summer
node.description: Businesses in Franz Josef and Fox Glacier are hundreds of staff short for the summer season with many struggling to find and afford workers.

node.title: "Disastrous": Locals speak out against putting mining wastewater in well
node.description: Officials want to put millions of gallons of wastewater in a deep injection well. But with a long history of incidents and issues, locals and some officials say they have "zero confidence" there won't be any problems.

node.title: Metaverse now: The top AR and VR devcices you can today
node.description: The metaverse isn't just a concept — with the right gear, you can start exploring it immediately.  Here's how.

node.title: From Soap Opera to Art: Why a Moscow Museum Is Re-Enacting ‘Santa Barbara’
node.description: A new contemporary art space is probing how Russia engages with the West by reviving an unlikely 1990s TV hit.

node.title: Bonnie’s, From a Win Son Chef, Opens in Williamsburg, Brooklyn
node.description: A cafe in the new Irish Arts Center, Chicago-style pizza in the West Village, and more restaurant news.

node.title: Iran Deporting Up to 30K Afghans Per Week As Illegal Migration Spikes Under Taliban Rule
node.description: Iran, which already hosts around 3 million Afghan residents, has had to deport over one million Afghans as of November 21 as they flee in large numbers.

node.title: From Mistletoe to Holly, These 10 Christmas Plants Could Be Toxic to Your Pet Dog
node.description: While holly, mistletoe and Christmas trees are part of the festive season, they can be toxic to our four-legged friends.

node.title: Video Shows Moment Gunman Opens Fire on Pedestrians in Front of New York City Deli
node.description: No arrests had been made in connection with the mid-November shooting by midday Tuesday, according to police.

node.title: Oxford School District Declines Michigan AG's Offer to Investigate What Led to Shooting
node.description: The district chose to have a third party investigate the events leading up to the November 30 shooting at the high school in which four students were killed.

node.title: Is foam rolling actually effective for muscle pain and flexibility?
node.description: Many people swear by foam rollers to reduce muscle pain and increase flexibility after exercise. But does the science support anecdotal evidence that encourages their use?

node.title: 'We have to filter out the crispy bits': How leftover chip oil will keep EV owners moving across the Nullarbor
node.description: EV owners are crowdfunding a fast charger in the middle of the Nullarbor — and it will run on leftover chip oil from the local roadhouse.

node.title: The surprising architect behind Labor's climate plans? A retiring Coalition minister
node.description: Before he became Health Minister, Greg Hunt spent years thinking about mechanisms for getting emissions down – and if elected, Labor plans to road test the one he introduced, writes Peter Martin.

node.title: One step from a sporting revolution: How Usman Khawaja is changing the face of Australian cricket
node.description: Trailblazer Usman Khawaja talks about racism in cricket and urges Cricket Australia to diversify for the sake of the game.

node.title: Cryptocurrency scams have 'exploded' during the pandemic. These three Australians lost more than $600,000
